{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3525561,"name":"Trevor","username":"Trevor_Engstrom","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/trevor_engstrom/{size}/241003_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-13T01:49:31.708Z","cooked":"

Hi, we are using an alternate encoder adapter for our elevator but for some reason, it’s not giving us the actual value. The switch on the alternate adapter is on ABS-PWM and the through bore switch is on A. The data port is also set to Alternate Encoder on the spark. We get the value by using motor.getAbsoluteEncoder to print it out in the terminal. It’s saying numbers that are super close to 0 like 6.002E-6. Do any of you know how to fix this?

Solution: We fixed it by plugging it into the Rio.

You can’t use the alternate encoder adapter for absolute encoders. You need the (confusingly similar named) absolute encoder adapter for that. The alternate encoder adapter board only connects the A/B/Index pins to the SparkMax top sensor port.

I presume you’re controlling a Neo/Neo550 with this controller

Alternatively, you could make your own cable. The only requirement is that the appropriate pins are connected (specifically power/ground and the Abs/PWM signal).
